content.question: The function <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> is a linear transformation of vectors defined by <math alttext="L open parentheses vector v close parentheses equals A vector v"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is a transformation matrix. If matrix <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is defined as <math alttext="A 2 by 2 matrix. Row 1 column 1 is negative one half. Row 1 column 2 is negative fraction numerator square root of 3 and denominator 2 end fraction. Row 2 column 1 is fraction numerator square root of 3 and denominator 2 end fraction. Row 2 column 2 is negative one half."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mfrac><msqrt><mn>3</mn></msqrt><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>, which of the following describes the linear transformation?

choices.label: The linear transformation is a rotation by <math alttext="pi over 6"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> radians counterclockwise about the origin.
The linear transformation is a rotation by <math alttext="pi over 3"><mfrac><mi>π</mi><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> radians counterclockwise about the origin.

The linear transformation is a rotation by <math alttext="fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> radians counterclockwise about the origin.

The linear transformation is a rotation by <math alttext="fraction numerator 5 pi over denominator 6 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> radians counterclockwise about the origin.

content.answer: The linear transformation is a rotation by <math alttext="fraction numerator 2 pi over denominator 3 end fraction"><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math> radians counterclockwise about the origin.
